thread.title: Evergreens settle for a draw with Tigers
thread.title_full: Evergreens settle for a draw with Tigers

title: Evergreens settle for a draw with Tigers
text:
Evergreens settle for a draw with Tigers Daily Herald Media 11:40 p.m. CDT October 13, 2015 Prep roundup 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WESTON — Rarely does a soccer coach enjoy settling for a tie, but D.C. Everest boys coach Manny Pollak had every reason to be ecstatic with a draw Tuesday night. 
With the help of seven saves by keeper Alex Pagel, the Evergreens secured the outright Wisconsin Valley Conference championships for first time in school history with a 0-0 tie against Marshfield on Senior Night. 
“Being the first conference (boys soccer) championship in school history, I don’t think the guys understand how much it means to this program right now,” Pollak said. “It might sink in in a couple days. 
“It means a tremendous amount to us,” Pollak added. “Some of these seniors have been with team and played for four years. The seniors gave everything they’ve got and the younger players rallied around them.” 
Marshfield 
Saves: Marshfield (Mathias Holm) 7; D.C. Everest (Alex Pagel) 7. 
Records: DCE 14-1-2, 9-1-1 WVC; Marshfield 7-3-1 WVC. 
Wausau East 2, Wausau West 1 
WAUSAU — Adam Hahn and Landon Dehnel each knocked in a goal for the Lumberjacks in their win against rival Wausau West in the Wisconsin Valley Conference matchup. 
The Lumberjacks and Warriors were also playing for the rights to the “Wausau Cup,” which West won on penalty kicks after the rivals split their regular season matches. 
Wausau West 
0 
2-2 
Second half: 1. WE, Adam Hahn (Charlie Keefe), 59:21; 2. WW, Steven Lewendowski (Alex Names), 77:53; 3. WE, Landon Dehnel (unassisted), 88:48. 
Saves: Wausau East (Sam Petralia) 4; Wausau West (Thomas Hogan) 9. 
Record: Wausau East 6-11-1, 2-9 WVC. 
VOLLEYBALL 
Marshfield 3, D.C. Everest 2 
MARSHFIELD — Ultimately, the Tigers made a few more plays down the stretch and outlasted the Evergreens to pick up a 25-16, 19-25, 24-26, 25-22, 15-10 win in the Wisconsin Valley Conference showdown. 
“It was definitely a hard-fought match between two teams that wanted it badly,” D.C. Everest coach Rita Jasurda said. “Marshfield played very well defensively, and I thought we did a nice job hitting between and around the blocks. 
“It’s a tough loss for us, we would loved to have ended with a win, but we came up a little bit short.” 
Jenna Rombalski and Regan Stefan paced the DCE hitting attack with 13 kills apiece, while Caroline Hehir and Natalie Mohring handed out 22 and 19 assists, respectively. 
Alyssa Frahm keyed the defense with 29 digs and Stefan added 18 digs. Mohring also served up six aces, with Lexie Higgins turning in four blocks. 
Mosinee 3, Rhinelander 1 
RHINELANDER — Claire Nievinski led Mosinee (25-18, 8-4 GNC) with 16 kills, 23 assists and 11 digs in their last regular season game against the Hodags. 
Mosinee won 25-19, 24-26, 26-24, 25-19 in the Great Northern Conference matchup. Janae Antosch had 10 kills, 19 assists and 17 digs, while Alexis Worzella added 19 digs in the win. 
Merrill 3, Wausau East 0 
WAUSAU — Morgan Wardell had 11 kills to lead the way for the Blue Jays (32-6-1) in the win over the Lumberjacks. Teammates Chey Pyka and Ali Zamzow chipped in 10 and 15 digs, respectively. 
The Blue Jays won the Wisconsin Valley Conference match 25-16, 25-19, 25-10. 
Emily Page led the Blue Jays with 28 assists and also contributed 4 digs while Anna Finnell added 8 kills in the win. 
“It was good to win in 3 sets tonight after a disappointing loss to Marshfield on Saturday,” said Merrill coach Kris Klug. “We played better as a team and we were able to utilize our offense more. We had aggressive serving from Maddix Bonnell, Ali Zamzow and Kelsie Belfiori to help pad us a lead in sets 2 and 3.” 
Wisconsin Valley Lutheran 3, Almond-Bancroft 0 
MOSINEE — Brianna Borski had 10 digs in the Eagles losing effort against the Wolves. 
The Wolves won 25-21, 25-21, 25-14. Kara Cisewski added three kills and Catie Schmidt had two kills and three blocks in the loss. 
Marawood Conference Volleyball Crossover 
MARATHON — Mariah Whalen led the Newman Cardinals with 28 kills, 16 digs and two aces while Taylor Janikowski added three aces of her own. Taylor Hackel was credited with 12 kills and 4.5 blocks in the win over the Phillips Loggers. 
The Cardinals won 25-18, 22-25, 25-13, 25-18 in the Marawood Crossover matchup. 
Abby Fox led the top-ranked Cardinals with 35 assists with teammate Riley Vaughn posting 14 assists and 19 digs. 
Results: Newman 3, Phillips 1; Marathon 3, Abbotsford 0; Auburndale 3, Athens 1; Stratford 3, Edgar 1; Rib Lake 3, Assumption 1; Northland Lutheran 3, Prentice 1; Chequamegon 3, Pittsville 0. 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://wdhne.ws/1RGEnhU TOP VIDEOS
